Welcome to pytnm’s documentation!¶

Contents:

Created on Sat Jul 11 11:14:37 2015

Purpose: Quickly assess the feasibility and reasonableness of a given barrier design, given a reduction design goal, a reasonable cost, and any other state-specific criteria

@author: Brandon

class barrier.Analysis(wbname, barsheet, sndsheet, barcost=None)[source]¶

Barrier analysis class

This class will contain several read-only properties that will aid in documenting the feasibility and reasonableness of a given barrier design modelled in the FHWA TNM 2.5. Information is pulled from an ”.xlsx” wb of any name with the assumption that the Barrier Design Table results and Sound Level Results tables are copied AS-IS directly from TNM 2.5 to two separate worksheets in the ”.xlsx” workbook.

  • parameters
Parameters:
  • wbname – ”.xlsx” file on disk (i.g. “Barriers.xlsx”)
  • barsheet – worksheet in ”.xlsx” containing Barrier Design Table
  • sndsheet – “worksheet in ”.xlsx” containing Sound Level Results
  • barriercost – cost of barrier design, as reported by TNM 2.5
ben_and_imp¶

List of impacted receivers in this analysis that are benefitted (<= 5dBA)

ben_and_imp_num¶

Return number of benefitted and impacted receptors in barrier analysis

benefit_num¶

Return number of benefitted receptors in barrier analysis

benefitted¶

List any receivers in this analysis that are benefitted (<= 5dBA)

du_in_analysis¶

Number of receptors in this analysis

feasible¶

Barrier design is feasible if 75% or more of impacted receivers receive a 5dBA or more noise reduction

impact_num¶

Return number of impacted receptors in barrier analysis

impacted_recs¶

List impacted receivers that are part of this barrier analysis

perc_ben_reasonable¶

Return percentage of benefits in barrier analysis that receive an reasonable reduction

perc_imp_benefitted¶

Return percentage of total receivers in barrier analysis that receive a 5 dBA reduction

reas_red_num¶

Return number of benefitted receptors in barrier analysis that are receiving a reasonable noise reduction

reas_red_recs¶

List receivers from this barrier analysis that are receiving a reasonable noise reduction, as determined by the noise reduction design goal

reasonable¶

Barrier design is reasonable if 80% or more of benefitted receivers receive a 8dBA or more noise reduction

recs_in_analysis¶

List receivers, DU, barrier reduction value, reduction goal, and impact status in chosen barrier analysis

report()[source]¶

Report of results. Useful for report writing or debugging.

snd_rec_list¶

Return list of receivers, DUs, and impact status from TNM Sound Results table

Depending on TNM model setup, this may not match the receivers included in the barrier analysis.
